column8: http://www.malaysiakini.com/news/380213The High Court in Penang has fixed July 26 for case management on the corruption trial of Penang Chief Minister Lim Guan Eng and businesswoman Phang Li Koon.The move is to allow the appeal by Lim and Phang to challenge the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) Act 2009.This is to be heard on April 27, in the Court of Appeal in Putrajaya."We plan to challenge the MACC Act up to the Federal Court," Lim's legal counsel RSN Rayer said after the date was fixed before High Court judge Hadhariah Syed Ismail.Phang was represented by Hisham Teh, while DPP Masry Daud appeared for the prosecution.Last month, Justice Hadhariah allowed the application by Lim's counsel Gobind Singh Deo to stay the corruption trial pending the outcome of their appeal in the Court of Appeal.This followed the High Court's March 7 rejection of the petitions by Lim and Phang to have Section 62 of the MACC Act declared "unconstitutional and void'.Section 62 states that once the prosecution submits documents pursuant to Section 51A of the Criminal Procedure Code, the accused shall, before the trial begins, submit (a) a statement of defence and (b) a copy of any document that can be presented as part of the evidence for the defence.Read more: https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/380213#ixzz4fETvJ7nC
